name: Hotel Edelweiss - Manotel Geneva

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a surprising little Hotel. The reception area is filled with Cuddly St Bernard dogs, and has swiss-pine woodwork. Staff were friendly and polite. Our room again had a Chalet feel due to the intricate carving. The Bathroom was spotless and Art Deco in style. The Restaurant is excellent although you have to endure the Youdeling duo. They were quite entertaining and played just about every derivative of swiss instrument imaginable. Also the double bass and electric guitar.
reviews.title: Totally Swiss

likes.liked: — Mock Swiss Chalet in dining room

reviews.title: A wonderful stay at the Edelweiss
reviews.text: Breakfasts were a bit disappointing, but don't let this put you off as you'll be scoffing choc's all day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recommended for it's novelty factor
reviews.title: Nice little hotel

likes.liked: — beautiful wood paneling in the rooms

reviews.text: Our stay at the Edelweiss was from September 10 thru 13, 2006 and found it to be a wonderful hotel.
reviews.title: Total Disappointment Edelweiss

reviews.text: The location is great, the rooms are neat, clean, large and confortable. My wife compared it to visiting a friends home and staying in their guest room.
reviews.title: A taste of Swiss Chalet Style

likes.disliked: — The long walk from the train station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its quaint, the lift it big enough for 2 people and the rooms are typically Swiss. The Manotel Edelwiess is a great value, quality 3* hotel that punches well above its weight.
reviews.title: Well Above Average 3*

reviews.text: The staff are great (and multilingual), the hotel amenities are first class, the rooms are clean and warm and the hotel has windows you can open - somewhat of a lost art!
reviews.title: Nice accomodations for good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location around a miriad of different restaurants, the 'not-so-seedy' redlight district and with the lake a mere 90 seconds walk away, there is no better value in Geneva.
reviews.title: Great quality at great price!

reviews.text: I stayed here 2 nights, one night each to and from skiing. During the first visit the hotel restaurant was open and provided a lot of good Swiss entertainment and food. The second stay the restaurant was closed, but the front desk staff helped us find another place serving fondue right around the corner.
reviews.title: Cant recommend highly enough! Stay here!

reviews.text: The rooms are very nice, bathrooms spotless. We walked from the train station to the hotel, very easy. It is about a 15-20 minute walk over to the other side of the lake where there is more action and ambience.
reviews.title: St. Bernard Heaven
Very good hotel
reviews.text: Edelweiss is a very good hotel in a great location. It's a 10 minute walk from the train station and all of the city sights are well within walking distance. The staff was very helpful and the room was extremely clean. A little pricey but it is Geneva...
The hotel was also very accommodating as they let us into our room at 9:00 a.m. on a Sunday as our international flight had just arrived -- very helpful!
reviews.title: My favorite hotel during our Switzerland/France stay

likes.liked: — Warm, welcoming, atmosphere and quite, comfortable rooms.

reviews.text: The staff spoke great english and breakfast was more than adequate, too.
reviews.title: Charming Swiss Ambiance

likes.disliked: — tiny, tiny elevator, extremely narrow steps, street steps at entrance

reviews.title: Really loved the Edelweiss Hotel, Geneva
reviews.text: Highly recommended!

We loved the Edelweiss! It was the first hotel of our trip and it was also our favorite. We had two rooms that were connecting for our children and ourselves. The rooms were spotless, comfortable and welcoming. We had a wonderful nights sleep. The staff of the hotel were friendly and the fondue dinner was very enjoyable. We were suffering from jet-lag so it was so nice to just walk down the stairs to get to dinner.
reviews.title: Weekend at the Edelweiss

likes.liked: — Clean, comfortable and a good location, near the lake
likes.disliked: — Small lift and no hotel car parking

reviews.text: I just loved my stay there short of being able to sejourn in a swiss mountain getaway. Staff is as colourful as the hotel´s ambiance. I loved their restaurant and got to sample an excellent cheese fondue ( rare to find in geneva despite what one may think...). I had stayed at this hotel 3 years ago and was pleased to discover that it now faces a quiet pedestrian plaza which made my stay even more enjoyable.
reviews.title: Great fun little hotel with swiss chalet ambiance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location with all you could need nearby and public transport on the opposite side of the street for those who can t be bothered to walk the 20 min walk it would take to cross the bridge and enjoy the heart of downtown and their ubershops on the left bank.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel any month of the year. Its particular swiss chalet ambiance is rather unique for a city hotel.
reviews.title: Cute hotel with Swiss theme

reviews.text: Stayed at the Edelweiss for three nights last weekend and it was great. The location is superb with cafes and a great Swiss restaurant just around the corner 'Auberge de Saviese' serving the full range of fondues. We could not get a table in the hotel restaurant on the Saturday such was the demand. The staff could not have been more courteous. The lift is rather small and the bed was a little firm but the pillows were magnificent, large and soft. Our room was spotlessly clean as was the rest of the hotel. Public transport is directly outside and the lake is a five minute walk where you can hop on a boat and cross the lake to the old part of town. If you do not book breakfast there is an abundance of croissanterie within 100 metres, the best of which we found was in the Migros supermarket just down the road. When we return we will almost certainly use this hotel.
reviews.title: Loved the Staff, Location

reviews.text: Stayed at the Edelweiss for 3 nights and enjoyed it. Staff is very friendly and speaks good English. Room was decent size, bed was 2 twins pushed together (common in Europe). Hotel is clean, friendly, and has 1 computer with free internet access.
reviews.title: Great value for a cheap holiday in Geneva.

likes.liked: — good location and very clean and inexpensive

description: Discover the Alps in the heart of Geneva. Come to the Hotel Edelweiss and delight in the warmth of an authentic Swiss chalet. It’s the next best thing to being on an alpine meadow. City centre, just steps away from the lake. 42 air-conditioned rooms. Minibar, interactive TV. Restaurant Edelweiss with live folk music, authentic Swiss cuisine. Round-the-clock room service. Laundry. Business centre. Free public transport card.
